Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2008 11:36AM - edited Nov 6, 2008 11:42AM by TigerLily4 I realize this is probably going to sound stupid, but I didn't realize it until I asked the physicist yesterday.  The MammoSite treatment uses Iridium 192.  Traditional radiation uses a high intensity x-ray. It wouldn't have changed my mind about treatment, but did your doctors tell you this before treatment?  I guess I thought everyone got radiation treatment from radioactive materials.
